anthracnose.name: Anthracnose
anthracnose.causalAgent: Fungi of the genus Elsinoe and related genera
anthracnose.symptoms: Circular lesions with dark centers and reddish-brown borders on leaves, fruit, and stems. Lesions may coalesce, leading to large necrotic areas.
anthracnose.impact: Can cause defoliation, reduced yield, and affect fruit quality.
anthracnose.management: Fungicides, pruning infected plant parts, and maintaining good air circulation to reduce humidity.

black_measles.name: Black Measles
black_measles.symptoms: Small, dark, raised spots on leaves and fruit. Lesions may coalesce, forming streaks on stems and canes.
black_measles.impact: Leads to reduced yield and affects fruit quality.
black_measles.management: Fungicides, pruning infected canes, and promoting good vine hygiene.

black_rot.name: Black Rot
black_rot.symptoms: Brown lesions with black fruiting bodies on leaves, fruit, and stems. Infected berries become shriveled and black.
black_rot.impact: Causes significant economic losses due to fruit decay and reduced yield.
black_rot.management: Fungicides, proper pruning, and removal of infected plant material.

downy_mildew.name: Downy Mildew
downy_mildew.symptoms: Yellow lesions on the upper surface of leaves with white, downy growth on the lower surface. Infected fruit may show water-soaked lesions.
downy_mildew.impact: Leads to defoliation, reduced photosynthesis, and lower yields.
downy_mildew.management: Fungicides, cultural practices to reduce humidity, and resistant grape varieties.

healthy.name: Healthy
healthy.description: This category refers to grapevines that do not show symptoms of any diseases. Maintaining vine health involves proper cultural practices, regular monitoring, and disease prevention strategies.

leaf_spot.name: Leaf Spot
leaf_spot.causalAgent: Various fungi such as Cercospora and Phyllosticta
leaf_spot.symptoms: Circular, dark lesions on leaves with defined margins. Lesions may coalesce, leading to premature defoliation.
leaf_spot.impact: Can reduce photosynthesis and affect grape quality.
leaf_spot.management: Fungicides, pruning, and maintaining proper vine spacing for good air circulation.

powdery_mildew.name: Powdery Mildew
powdery_mildew.symptoms: White, powdery spots on leaves, which later turn brown. Infected berries may crack and shrivel.
powdery_mildew.impact: Decreases photosynthesis, reduces yield, and affects fruit quality.
powdery_mildew.management: Fungicides, sulfur treatments, and cultural practices to reduce humidity.
